clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Fermented Milk Containing Lactobacillus Casei Strain Shirota on Chinese People With Constipation

brief_summary.textblock: Constipation is a prevalent intestinal disorder. Lactobacillus casei strain Shirota (LcS) shows potential effect on alleviating constipation. This study evaluated the impact of fermented milk containing LcS on stool consistency and frequency. The stool short chain fatty acid and gut microbiota were also assessed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline stool consistency at four-week intervention
change from baseline defecation frequency at four-week intervention
change from baseline constipation-related symptom scores at four-week intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in stool short chain fatty acid content
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline stool short chain fatty acid content at four-week intervention
change from baseline gut microbiota at four-week intervention

arm_group.description: Patients with constipation received dietary supplement with Lactobacaiilus casei strain Shirota.

intervention.description: a bottle of 100 mililiter probiotic dairy beverage containing 10^8 CFU Lactobacillus casei strain Shirota every day after lunch.
